greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=a(2)=1; thereafter a(n) = gpf(a(n-1)+a(n-2)), where gpf = "greatest prime factor".
comment: Rapidly enters a loop with period 3,5,2,7.
More generally, if a(1) and a(2) are distinct positive numbers with a(1)+a(2) >= 2, the sequence eventually enters the cycle {7,3,5,2} [Back and Caragiu].
link: G. Back and M. Caragiu, The greatest prime factor and recurrent sequences, Fib. Q., 48 (2010), 358-362.
mathematica: nxt[{a_,b_}]:={b,FactorInteger[a+b][[-1,1]]}; Transpose[NestList[nxt,{1,1},120]][[1]] (* or *) PadRight[{1,1,2},130,{5,2,7,3}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 24 2015 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 16 2010
